node.doctext:
[gods|admins] have their C!s set to 0 every other day. (Update: this doesn't seem to happen to editors; sorry to pester you about this.) This happens regardless of the number of C!s the user has used. The Epicenter display shows 0 C!s, which accurately reflects the user's $$VARS{cools} value of 0. Of course, this value is incorrect in the first place. Note: there are no problems of C!ing, just the display (and the information behind that) is wrong.

Update: it turns out it was only me. When I was working on something else, in a certain page, I made it give me 0 C!s left when I viewed it. So as soon as I viewed this page, I lost all my C!s for that day. If I didn't view that page, I had my normal C!s.
node.title: C! allocation for editors
